definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
select the best people for promotion
to pass the civil service examination (in imperial China)
lit. as difficult to count as hair pulled from sb's head (idiom)/fig. innumerable (crimes)

sentences.english: We've planted thousands of trees in the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 疇昔幾何年咱們種了擢領易數棵樹。

sentences.english: He also had a gift for putting people at their ease.
sentences.chinese: 另外，他對於擢英才於未顯也頗有天賦。

definition: to attend/to take office/to be present (in administrative capacity)
appointment (to a job)/to be appointed (to high office)/to accept an appointment/entrusted with responsibilities/same as 授任
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Minister of imperial stud, originally charged with horse breeding

to pass the civil service examination (in imperial China)
